content:
Sure! Here are some examples of Jack using his powers in a prose style:

As the mugger closed in, Jack raised his hand and focused his will. With a flick of his wrist, the mugger was sent flying backwards, crashing into a trash bin with a loud thud.

"That's for messing with the wrong guy," Jack said, dusting off his hands.

He turned to Sarah, who was watching the scene with a mix of shock and admiration. "Come on, let's get out of here before he comes to."

Sarah nodded and followed Jack as he led the way through the crowded streets. They had learned to be careful, never staying in one place for too long.

As they walked, Jack could feel the familiar tingle in his fingers. It was a sign that his powers were getting stronger, and he knew he had to be careful not to let them get out of control.

But when they stumbled upon a group of kids being bullied by a group of older teens, Jack couldn't resist the urge to intervene. He raised his hand and a burst of flame shot out, sending the bullies running.

The kids looked at him in amazement as Jack helped them to their feet. "Thanks, mister," one of them said, looking up at him with wide eyes.

Jack grinned and ruffled the kid's hair. "Anytime. Now get out of here before they come back."

As they watched the kids run off, Sarah shook her head and laughed. "You never change, do you?"

Jack shrugged and grinned. "Some things are just worth fighting for."
